recipes.name: Hamburgers
recipes.description: Classic American hamburgers are juicy beef patties served on a bun with your favorite toppings.

ingredients.cheese: 4 slices cheese (cheddar, American, Swiss, or your choice)

instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder. Mix gently until the seasonings are evenly distributed.
Divide the seasoned ground beef into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties, about 1/2 to 3/4 inch thick.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush the grates or pan with vegetable oil to prevent sticking.
Place the burger patties on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium doneness, or adjust the cooking time according to your preference.
During the last minute of cooking, add a slice of cheese on top of each patty to melt.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill until lightly golden.
Assemble the hamburgers by placing lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, onions, and pickles on the bottom half of each bun.
Place a cooked cheeseburger patty on top of the vegetables, then add condiments such as ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise.
Top with the other half of the hamburger bun and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spaghetti and Meatballs
recipes.description: Spaghetti and meatballs is a classic Italian-American dish featuring pasta topped with savory meatballs and marinara sauce.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, chopped onion, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, salt, and black pepper. Mix until well combined.
Shape the meat mixture into golf ball-sized meatballs.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the meatballs in a single layer and cook until browned on all sides, about 8-10 minutes.
Pour the marinara sauce over the meatballs in the skillet. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through.
Serve the cooked spaghetti topped with meatballs and marinara sauce.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and grated Parmesan cheese.
Enjoy your delicious homemade Spaghetti and Meatballs!
